snippet: Senators Charles E. Schumer of New York and Robert Menendez of New Jersey modeled their Hurricane Sandy measure on 2005 legislation passed to help those affected by Hurricane Katrina.
abstract: Senators Charles E Schumer of New York and Robert Menendez of New Jersey are proposing billions of dollars in tax breaks to help individuals and businesses rebuild in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy; tax package is modeled on legislation passed in 2005 to aid victims of Hurricane Katrina.
lead_paragraph: Senators Charles E. Schumer of New York and Robert Menendez of New Jersey modeled their Hurricane Sandy measure on 2005 legislation passed to help those affected by Hurricane Katrina.

headline.seo: Schumer and Menendez Propose Tax Breaks for Storm Victims
headline.main: Senators Propose Tax Breaks for Storm Cleanup
headline.print_headline: Senators Propose Tax Breaks for Storm Cleanup
